person_analysis.overview: Albert Chen is a venture partner at Two Small Fish Ventures, leveraging a background in systems engineering, optics, and medical devices to identify and support high-impact startups in AI, energy, and advanced technologies. With a Ph.D. from the University of Waterloo and leadership experience scaling engineering teams at Forcen and Metergy, Albert combines technical depth with entrepreneurial leadership.
person_analysis.executive_summary: A technologist turned venture partner, Albert Chen bridges deep engineering expertise with startup growth and investment. His career spans robotics, optics, smart energy, and now venture capital, where he focuses on transformative startups. With patents, publications, and executive leadership under his belt, he brings both credibility and a vision for impactful technology ecosystems.
key_insights: Strong foundation in engineering leadership across medtech, robotics, optics, and energy.
Academic pedigree (Ph.D., multiple publications, NSERC-funded) translates into deep technical evaluation skills for venture investing.
Credible community builder and mentor with a history of scaling teams and guiding student projects.
